Key Match Events: Nathan Lukes hit a double down the left-field line that drove home George Springer from first with the eventual winning run in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Manager John Schneider emphasized the importance of winning games consistently after a tough year
Post-Match Reflections: Manager John Schneider expressed pride in the team's job well done in sweeping the series
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jays used five relievers after Rodriguez came out in the fifth, with the lone blemish on the group being a solo homer to Ivan Herrera in the fifth by Ryan Yarbrough
The Jays' fifth sweep of the season and third at home this year
Others: Davis Schneider continued his hot run of late, hitting a two-run homer in the fourth
Zach Pop picked up the win, getting the final out of the Cards eighth before Springer and Lukes combined to push the eventual winner across in the bottom of the inning
